item.title: Hello, World!
item.description:
Hello, World!

Posted on August 7, 2016

Here’s some code:

module Main where

main :: IO ()
main = putStrLn "Hello, world!"

Let’s run it!

λ> main
Hello, world!

It works!

Now let’s define a function in ghci:

λ> let replicateMain n = replicateM_ n main

<interactive>:13:23:
    Not in scope: ‘replicateM_’
    Perhaps you meant one of these:
      ‘replicate’ (imported from Prelude), ‘replicateMain’ (line 13)

Oops!

λ> import Control.Monad
λ> let replicateMain n = replicateM_ n main
λ> :t replicateMain
replicateMain :: Int -> IO ()
λ> replicateMain 2
Hello, world!
Hello, world!
λ> replicateMain 5
Hello, world!
Hello, world!
Hello, world!
Hello, world!
Hello, world!

It works!
